replies.bodyText:
This is workaround for #9005 where NEWLINE may be too deep in the AST, for example:
  /**
   *
     @deprecated block tag
   */
AST is
|   |--BLOCK_COMMENT_BEGIN -> /* [1:2]
|   |   |--COMMENT_CONTENT -> *\n   *\n     @deprecated block tag\n    [1:4]
|   |   |   `--JAVADOC -> JAVADOC [1:5]
|   |   |       |--NEWLINE -> \n [1:5]
|   |   |       |--LEADING_ASTERISK ->    * [2:0]
|   |   |       |--NEWLINE -> \n [2:4]
|   |   |       |--TEXT ->       [3:0]
|   |   |       |--JAVADOC_TAG -> JAVADOC_TAG [3:5]
|   |   |       |   |--DEPRECATED_LITERAL -> @deprecated [3:5]
|   |   |       |   |--WS ->   [3:16]
|   |   |       |   `--DESCRIPTION -> DESCRIPTION [3:17]
|   |   |       |       |--TEXT -> block tag [3:17]
|   |   |       |       |--NEWLINE -> \n [3:26]                         // NEWLINE HERE
|   |   |       |       `--TEXT ->     [4:0]                                  // Blank text, ignored in isLastLine
|   |   |       `--EOF -> <EOF> [4:3]                                   // Next node, that is next sibling of grandparent
|   |   `--BLOCK_COMMENT_END -> */ [4:3]

If #9005 can be solved, your comment will be correct: no more than one node deep

The specification is very unclear in this case. Javadoc tool removes initial asterisks even in such comments:
/** * First line.
 * Second line.
 * */ // Last line
becomes "First line. Second line.", but no one writes Javadoc comments this way.
